item.title: Eyebright add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "There was a boy called Eustace Clarence Scrubb, and he almost deserved it." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "We are not necessarily doubting that God will do the best for us; we are wondering how painful the best will turn out to be." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Lewis Carroll
Eyebright add a quote by lewis carroll
item.description: "If you drink much from a bottle marked 'poison' it is certain to disagree with you sooner or later." -- lewis carroll

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description:
"When I use a word,’ Humpty Dumpty said in rather a scornful tone, ‘it means just what I choose it to mean — neither more nor less.’
’The question is,’ said Alice, ‘whether you can make words mean so many different things.’
’The question is,’ said Humpty Dumpty, ‘which is to be master — that’s all." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Tut, tut, child!" said the Duchess. "Everything's got a moral, if only you can find it." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Well, we all make mistakes, dear, so just put it behind you. We should regret our mistakes and learn from them, but never carry them forward into the future with us." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "How many observe Christ's birthday! How few, His precepts!" -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Ann Lloyd
item.description: "Who wants to go down the creepy tunnel inside the tomb first? <i>— Riley Poole</i>" -- Ann Lloyd

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by George Washington
item.description: "It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one." -- George Washington

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books" -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "For after all, the best thing one can do when it is raining is let it rain." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Music is the universal language of mankind." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Eyebright add a quote by Anonymous
item.description:
"Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: But a woman who fears the Lord, She shall be praised.
(Proverbs 31:30 Modern King James Version)" -- Anonymous
